spectroSLEUTH Functions

Functions to find and define emission-lines.

class sleuth.emission_lines(filepath, z, prominence=20)

Class containing functions to detect and identify emission lines

Parameters

  • filepath (string) – filepath to the spectrum data (fits format)

  • z (float) – redshift of the galaxy.

  • prominence (float, optional) – required prominence of peaks for emission-line detection threshold. default is 20.

line_detection()

Line Detection

This function will detect peaks by using the scipy find_peak function.

Parameters

declaration (variables defined in class) –

Returns

Table containing the observed and emitted wavelengths of detected emission lines. fig (figure): Figure showing the spectrum with detected emission-lines indicated by a vertical line.

Return type

results_table (astropy table)

line_identification()

Line Identification

This function take in identified peaks (redshifted back to rest) and compares them to a table of atomic wavelengths to identify ion

Parameters

declaration (variables defined in class) –

Returns

Table containing the observed and emitted wavelengths of detected emission lines, as well as the best guess for the corresponding ions responsible for the line. fig (figure): Figure showing the spectrum with detected emission-lines indicated by a vertical line and labeled ion.

Return type

results_table (astropy table)
